definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: Try to discourage such familiarities from your subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓下屬對你這樣不拘禮節。

sentences.english: The lack of proprieties would make the most intimate friends turn to be the most decided enemies.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏禮節會使最親密的朋友變成不共戴天的仇敵。

sentences.english: Charger plate etiquette and use varies among caterers and restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 餐位盤禮節和用途在承辦宴會者和餐館之間變化。

sentences.english: This distinctive lacing is worn on military boots by paratroopers and ceremonial guard units.
sentences.chinese: 這一共同的繫帶是由戴傘兵和禮節警衛部隊軍事靴子。

sentences.english: They are about to the stance with ritual, and get straight to the blood bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 他們注重禮節，採取硬碰硬，直到出血才罷休。

sentences.english: In the code of military etiquette silence and fixity are forms of deference.
sentences.chinese: 在軍事禮節的符號中，沉默和固定是順從的表示。

sentences.english: The netiquette is of great complexity.
sentences.chinese: 網絡禮節是很複雜的事。

sentences.english: Week after week she inculcated good manners in her pupils.
sentences.chinese: 她一週又一週地把良好的禮節反覆灌輸給她的學生。

sentences.english: The representatives of both sides reciprocated formal expressions of goodwill.
sentences.chinese: 雙方代表相互表達了禮節性的友好意願。

sentences.english: When your boss skips a few rules, he'sbeing original.
sentences.chinese: 老闆略過一些禮節，他獨具一格。

sentences.english: According to etiquette, you should stand up to meet a guest.
sentences.chinese: 按照禮節你應該站起來接待客人。

sentences.english: Even when she was angry, she observed the proprieties.
sentences.chinese: 甚至當她發怒的時候，都要遵從禮節。

sentences.english: There are certain forms that must be followed in diplomatic circles.
sentences.chinese: 在外交界有一些禮節是必須遵守的。

sentences.english: You should at least pay your formal respects to the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 你至少應該對這位主席給予禮節性的尊重。

sentences.english: China is a country with a time-honored civilization and a land of ceremony and decorum.
sentences.chinese: 中國是文明古國，禮儀之邦，很重禮節。

sentences.english: We share everything between and relate well to each other regardless of chinchin or ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 我們不分彼此，相處融洽，不必拘泥客套禮節。

definition: to control/to restrict/to moderate/to temper/moderation/sobriety/to administer
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
to echo one another/to respond (in agreement)
noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
